pullRequest.body:
This PR makes the following changes:

- Define a mixin class `NormMulClass` for norms satisfying `‚Äña * b‚Äñ = ‚Äña‚Äñ * ‚Äñb‚Äñ`, and show that any `NormedDivisionRing` satisfies it.
- Generalise some of the lemmas we currently have for `NormedDivisionRing` or `NormedField` to any normed ring satisfying `NormMulClass`.
- Rename the field `norm_mul` of the normed ring classes, which states that `‚Äña * b‚Äñ ‚â§ ‚Äña‚Äñ * ‚Äñb‚Äñ`, to `norm_mul_le`, to avoid a naming conflict with the `norm_mul` of `NormMulClass`.
- Rename the field `norm_smul_le` of `NormedSpace` and `NormedAlgebra` to `norm_smul_le'`, to avoid a naming conflict with the lemma inherited via `IsBoundedSMul`. [_These structure field renames are trivial, but make up most of the diff._] 
- Some minor cleanup I noticed along the way (e.g. deleting a bunch of unnecessary instances in `PadicInt`).

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [8ca18053d6](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22842/commits/8ca18053d66d0971ba39a925700b58fe3a6fe1fe)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Field.Basic | 1204 | 1203 | -1 (-0.08%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
|<details><summary>12 files</summary> `Mathlib.Analysis.Asymptotics.Defs` `Mathlib.Analysis.Asymptotics.Lemmas` `Mathlib.Analysis.Meromorphic.Divisor.Basic` `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Field.Basic` `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Field.Instances` `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Field.Ultra` `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.NullSubmodule` `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.MulAction` `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Operator.ContinuousLinearMap` `Mathlib.Order.Filter.ZeroAndBoundedAtFilter` `Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.InfiniteSum.Field` `Mathlib.Topology.MetricSpace.CauSeqFilter`</details>|-1|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Int.instNormMulClass`
`+ NormMulClass`
`+ NormMulClass.induced`
`+ NormMulClass.isAbsoluteValue_norm`
`+ NormMulClass.isDomain`
`+ NormMulClass.toNormOneClass`
`+ instance (priority := 100) NormedDivisionRing.toNormMulClass [Œ≤ : NormedDivisionRing Œ±] :`
`+ instance : NormMulClass ‚Ñ§_[p] := ‚ü®fun x y ‚Ü¶ by simp [norm_def]‚ü©`
`+ instance : NormedSpace ùïú C‚ÇÄ(Œ±, Œ≤) where norm_smul_le' k f := norm_smul_le k f.toBCF`
`+ instance [NonUnitalNormedCommRing E] : NonUnitalNormedCommRing (RestrictScalars ùïú ùïú' E) := ‚Äπ_‚Ä∫`
`+ instance [NonUnitalNormedRing E] : NonUnitalNormedRing (RestrictScalars ùïú ùïú' E) := ‚Äπ_‚Ä∫`
`+ instance [NonUnitalSeminormedCommRing E] : NonUnitalSeminormedCommRing (RestrictScalars ùïú ùïú' E)`
`+ instance [NonUnitalSeminormedRing E] : NonUnitalSeminormedRing (RestrictScalars ùïú ùïú' E) := ‚Äπ_‚Ä∫`
`+ instance [NormedAddCommGroup E] : NormedAddCommGroup (RestrictScalars ùïú ùïú' E) := ‚Äπ_‚Ä∫`
`+ instance [NormedCommRing E] : NormedCommRing (RestrictScalars ùïú ùïú' E) := ‚Äπ_‚Ä∫`
`+ instance [NormedRing E] : NormedRing (RestrictScalars ùïú ùïú' E) := ‚Äπ_‚Ä∫`
`+ instance [SeminormedAddCommGroup E] : SeminormedAddCommGroup (RestrictScalars ùïú ùïú' E) := ‚Äπ_‚Ä∫`
`+ instance [SeminormedCommRing E] : SeminormedCommRing (RestrictScalars ùïú ùïú' E) := ‚Äπ_‚Ä∫`
`+ instance [SeminormedRing E] : SeminormedRing (RestrictScalars ùïú ùïú' E) := ‚Äπ_‚Ä∫`
`+ toNormMulClass`
`+ toSeminormedRing`
`- Int.instNormOneClass`
`- instNormedSpace`
`- instance (priority := 900) NormedDivisionRing.to_normOneClass : NormOneClass Œ±`
`- instance : Add ‚Ñ§_[p] := (by infer_instance : Add (subring p))`
`- instance : AddCommGroup ‚Ñ§_[p] := (by infer_instance : AddCommGroup (subring p))`
`- instance : IsDomain ‚Ñ§_[p] := Function.Injective.isDomain (subring p).subtype Subtype.coe_injective`
`- instance : Mul ‚Ñ§_[p] := (by infer_instance : Mul (subring p))`
`- instance : Neg ‚Ñ§_[p] := (by infer_instance : Neg (subring p))`
`- instance : NormOneClass ‚Ñ§_[p]`
`- instance : NormedSpace ùïú C‚ÇÄ(Œ±, Œ≤) where norm_smul_le k f := (norm_smul_le k f.toBCF :)`
`- instance : One ‚Ñ§_[p] := ‚ü®‚ü®1, by norm_num‚ü©‚ü©`
`- instance : Sub ‚Ñ§_[p] := (by infer_instance : Sub (subring p))`
`- instance : Zero ‚Ñ§_[p] := (by infer_instance : Zero (subring p))`
`- instance [I : NonUnitalNormedCommRing E] :`
`- instance [I : NonUnitalNormedRing E] :`
`- instance [I : NonUnitalSeminormedCommRing E] :`
`- instance [I : NonUnitalSeminormedRing E] :`
`- instance [I : NormedAddCommGroup E] :`
`- instance [I : NormedCommRing E] :`
`- instance [I : NormedRing E] :`
`- instance [I : SeminormedAddCommGroup E] :`
`- instance [I : SeminormedCommRing E] :`
`- instance [I : SeminormedRing E] :`
`- isAbsoluteValue`
`- isAbsoluteValue_norm`
`- norm_mul_le`
`- norm_pow`
`- toSemiNormedRing`
`-- norm_mul`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

pullRequest.title: feat(Analysis/Normed): Class for strict multiplicativity of norm
